metadata.title: CVE-2016-9809 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
Off-by-one error in the gst_h264_parse_set_caps function in GStreamerbefore 1.10.2 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via acrafted file, which triggers an out-of-bounds read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-opencv - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-apps - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
libgstreamer-opencv1.0-0 - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.10.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.2-1ubuntu1').
